title: Youth-led protest halts illegal evictions
content: Hundreds of youth rallied peacefully in Nairobi after an exposé on land grabbing in informal settlements. The protest led to a temporary halt on all evictions.
Organized via Wajibu’s forum and backed by civic educators, it is a powerful example of informed civic action.
"We had evidence and civic knowledge. That’s power." — Eric Kamau, protest leader.

title: Community budget tracker exposes misuse of CDF funds
content: Using Wajibu’s budget scorecard, a local watchdog group in Machakos uncovered discrepancies in Constituency Development Fund allocations.
They filed an official complaint with the Ethics and Anti-Corruption Commission.
The MP has since responded and promised a public audit.

title: Civic education workshop transforms a village council
content: A training organized through Wajibu’s civic education portal empowered women in Kwale to demand inclusion in local council decisions.
Five new community members — four of them women — were recently added to the public participation committee.

title: Petition against unsafe road designs gains traction
content: A petition on Wajibu calling for redesigning a notorious road junction in Eldoret has gathered 12,000+ signatures.
The county government has agreed to conduct a site visit and consult locals.
